meanings.definition: Obtain or secure (something desired or beneficial)
meanings.sent1: She will gain new knowledge from reading books.
meanings.sent2: He works hard to gain the trust of his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to gain access to the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The detective hoped to gain insight into the case.
meanings.sent5: With practice, you can gain confidence in your abilities.

meanings.definition: Increase in amount, size, or value
meanings.sent1: Eating healthy food can help you gain strength.
meanings.sent2: The company aims to gain market share this year.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started to gain altitude unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The plant will gain height as it grows taller.
meanings.sent5: Regular exercise can help you gain muscle mass.

meanings.sent1: Saving money is a financial gain for the future.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated their recent gain in points.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected discount was a gain for the shopper.
meanings.sent4: She considered the promotion a gain in her career.
meanings.sent5: Investing wisely can lead to a gain in wealth over time.
